revised_title: Astronomical Significance of Prehistoric Monuments in Western Europe
tldr: This article explores the astronomical significance of prehistoric monuments in Western Europe, focusing on the use of megalithic structures as lunar observatories. The author discusses the alignment of these monuments with the Sun and Moon during solstices and equinoxes, and how they were used to track lunar positions and establish a megalithic calendar. The study provides insights into the advanced knowledge of astronomy possessed by ancient people.
